result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No BMP

Clerk talked with E. Weihe from Justice Department. We determined that Defendant should have been removed from Bond monitoring back on 7/27/22 hearing. It was not due to the wording of what was ordered. Per E. Weihe we are removing BMP off bond.

Defendant John C. Curran appeared by phone.  Attorney Craig Gericke appeared by video for John C. Curran.  Attorney Croninger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney requests Jury Trial
JA to schedule 3 day jury trial

Defendant John C. Curran appeared by phone.  Attorney Long appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Caulum appears for Attorney Gericke by video for John C. Curran. Amanda from Justice Department appears via zoom video. Motion to modify bond for GPS to be removed and so Defendant to have contact with child. Motion denied regarding contact with child. Justice Department gives updates- give written warning, etc. Court will amend bond by removing the GPS device. The rest of the conditions remain the same.
Plea/Schedule on September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant John C. Curran appeared by video.  Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Craig Gericke appeared by video for John C. Curran. Attorney waives reading of information. Court enters not guilty pleas. Charges and max penalties were read.
